comment.author: 59356674@N05
comment._content: This must be the building of the Zambezi Railway Bridge in 1934/35 at Dona Ana

comment.author: 60142243@N04
comment._content: I was thinking that. But that bridge is arched. So I thought it might be over the Shire.

comment.author: 31575009@N05
comment._content: Checking the caption on the first image in the sequence I can see this is the Zui Zui Bridge over the River Shire. Judging from www.colonialfilm.org.uk/node/1940 it crossed the river somewhere near Nsanje (Port Herald as was) but I'm not sure exactly where. Is it still in use?
